domain_prompt:
You are a planning agent in a simplified **Gripper** world (a classic IPC planning domain).

Scenario:
- There is one robot that can move between rooms.
- The robot has **two grippers** (gri_32fce4 and gri_42e92a). Each gripper can hold at most one ball.
- A ball is either in a room or being carried in exactly one gripper.

Legal actions (use these exact action names):
1) move FROM TO
   - Preconditions: the robot is in room FROM.
   - Effects: the robot is now in room TO.
2) pick BALL ROOM GRIPPER
   - Preconditions: the robot is in ROOM; BALL is in ROOM; GRIPPER is free.
   - Effects: BALL is carried in GRIPPER; GRIPPER is no longer free; BALL is no longer in ROOM.
3) drop BALL ROOM GRIPPER
   - Preconditions: the robot is in ROOM; BALL is carried in GRIPPER.
   - Effects: BALL is placed in ROOM; GRIPPER becomes free.

Invariants / reminders:
- You can only pick up balls in the room where the robot currently is.
- To transport a ball to another room you must: pick -> move -> drop.
- You may carry up to two balls at a time (one per gripper).
- Try to minimize the number of actions.

OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT):
Return ONLY a fenced code block containing one action per line, in the following machine-readable format:
- (move FROM TO)
- (pick BALL ROOM GRIPPER)
- (drop BALL ROOM GRIPPER)

Use exactly the object names provided in the task (e.g., roo_bcabae, roo_59c817, bal_07e7cd, gri_32fce4).
No numbering, no explanations, no extra text.

Example:
```
(pick bal_07e7cd roo_bcabae gri_32fce4)
(pick bal_e201c6 roo_bcabae gri_42e92a)
(move roo_bcabae roo_59c817)
(drop bal_07e7cd roo_59c817 gri_32fce4)
(drop bal_e201c6 roo_59c817 gri_42e92a)
```

actions.name: move
preconditions: The robot is in room FROM.
effects: The robot is no longer in room FROM.
The robot is now in room TO.

actions.name: pick
effects: BALL is no longer in ROOM.

actions.name: drop
effects: BALL is no longer carried by GRIPPER.

problems.prompt:
Rooms: roo_bcabae, roo_59c817. Grippers: gri_32fce4, gri_42e92a. Balls: bal_07e7cd.
Initial: the robot is in roo_bcabae; gri_32fce4 and gri_42e92a are free; all balls are in roo_bcabae.
Goal: all balls must end up in roo_59c817.

OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (move FROM TO), (pick BALL ROOM GRIPPER), (drop BALL ROOM GRIPPER). Use the object names exactly; no extra text.

overview.description: Transport all balls from roo_bcabae to roo_59c817 using a two-gripper robot.
overview.initial_state: Robot in roo_bcabae; gri_32fce4 and gri_42e92a are free; balls in roo_bcabae: bal_07e7cd.
overview.goal: All balls are in roo_59c817: bal_07e7cd.
